Class SingleBoat

java.lang.Object
SingleBoat
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class SingleBoat extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single boat in the fleet. Each boat stores its type, name, year of manufacture, make/model, length, purchase price, and total expenses.
Version:
1.1
Author:
Aakash Singh
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • SingleBoat

      public SingleBoat(BoatType type, String name, int year, String makeModel, double length, double purchasePrice)
      Constructs a SingleBoat object with the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of boat (SAILING or POWER)
      name - The name of the boat
      year - The year of manufacture
      makeModel - The make and model of the boat
      length - The length of the boat in feet
      purchasePrice - The purchase price of the boat

  • Method Details

    • addExpense

      public boolean addExpense(double amount)
      Adds an expense to the boat if it does not exceed the purchase price.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to spend on the boat
      Returns:
      true if expense is allowed, false if exceeds purchase price
